instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the accuracy of the models to estimate the surface water fraction, and how far can this metric go in assessing the performance?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the accuracy of the models in this study was the coefficient of determination (R-2), which measures the proportion of the variance in the observed data that is predictable from the independent variables in the model. This metric can range from 0 to 1, with a higher value indicating a better fit of the model to the data.

In assessing the performance, the R-2 value can provide an indication of how well the model explains the variability in the surface water fraction data. A value of 1 would indicate that the model perfectly predicts the observed data, while a value of 0 would suggest that the model does not explain any of the variability.
